Abstract: This study explores the evolving landscape of sustainability careers, focusing on the competencies and training required for professionals in green jobs. Through a comprehensive review of existing literature and an analysis of job market trends, the research identifies key competencies such as systems thinking, environmental knowledge, and stakeholder engagement as essential for success in sustainability roles. The study also examines the curricula of leading academic programs to assess their alignment with industry needs, highlighting gaps and opportunities for improvement. Findings suggest that interdisciplinary training and practical experience are crucial for preparing the workforce for the transition to a sustainable economy. Recommendations include the development of more tailored training programs and the integration of real-world projects into curricula to enhance the readiness of future sustainability professionals.
